title: Are there any recent classical theories of consciousness that supports the mind is a product of brain 'monism' and falsifies 'Orch OR' theory of quantum mind and dualism? - Quora

response.answer_text: Are there any recent classical theories of consciousness that supports the mind is a product of brain 'monism' and falsifies 'Orch OR' theory of quantum mind and dualism? Theories don’t support or falsify things like that - theories make predictions, which can then falsify something. So - if a theory makes a prediction different than what “mind is a product of brain monism” predicts, then testing that will support one prediction and falsify the other prediction (unless of course some *other* result is found, falsifying both of them). At that point, people supporting the theory whose prediction just got falsified get to either fix their theory so it predicts the now-established result, or toss it in the dumpster and follow it with a Molotov cocktail. For the record, at the current time, nobody reputable thinks “quantum mind” is anything other than “quantum woo” - we’re quite sure that consciousness is an emergent phenomenon having to do with the number of neurons and their interconnections, not quantum mechanics.

It isn’t really necessary to falsify Orch OR theory since there is no supporting evidence. It exists as a rather fanciful conjecture and little else. And dualism as a theory is even worse than Orch OR. All of the evidence supports the idea that consciousness is created by the operation of a brain.
